TypeSignature.Value: public class CCLabelBMFont : Cocos2D.CCSpriteBatchNode, Cocos2D.ICCLabelProtocol, Cocos2D.ICCRGBAProtocol
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCLabelBMFont extends Cocos2D.CCSpriteBatchNode implements class Cocos2D.ICCLabelProtocol, class Cocos2D.ICCRGBAProtocol

Docs.summary: <para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /> is a subclass of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSpriteBatchNode" />. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSpriteBatchNode" />
Docs.remarks: <para>Features:<list type="bullet"><item><description>Treats each character like a Sprite. This means that each individual character can be:</description></item><item><description>rotated</description></item><item><description>scaled</description></item><item><description>translated</description></item><item><description>tinted</description></item><item><description>change the opacity</description></item><item><description>It can be used as part of a menu item.</description></item><item><description>anchorPoint can be used to align the "label"</description></item><item><description>Supports AngelCode text format</description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>Treats each character like a Sprite. This means that each individual character can be:</description> </item> <item> <description>rotated</description> </item> <item> <description>scaled</description> </item> <item> <description>translated</description> </item> <item> <description>tinted</description> </item> <item> <description>change the opacity</description> </item> <item> <description>It can be used as part of a menu item.</description> </item> <item> <description>anchorPoint can be used to align the "label"</description> </item> <item> <description>Supports AngelCode text format</description> </item> </list><para>Treats each character like a <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" />. This means that each individual character can be:</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" /><para>rotated</para><para>scaled</para><para>translated</para><para>tinted</para><para>change the opacity</para><para>It can be used as part of a menu item.</para><para>anchorPoint can be used to align the "label"</para><para>Supports AngelCode text format</para><para>Limitations:<list type="bullet"><item><description>All inner characters are using an anchorPoint of (0.5f, 0.5f) and it is not recommend to change it because it might affect the rendering</description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>All inner characters are using an anchorPoint of (0.5f, 0.5f) and it is not recommend to change it because it might affect the rendering</description> </item> </list><para>All inner characters are using an anchorPoint of (0.5f, 0.5f) and it is not recommend to change it because it might affect the rendering</para><para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /> implements the protocol <ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_label_protocol" kindref="compound">LabelProtocol</ref>, like Label and <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelAtlas" />. <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /> has the flexibility of Label, the speed of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelAtlas" /> and all the features of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" />. If in doubt, use <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /> instead of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelAtlas" /> / Label.</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /><ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_label_protocol" kindref="compound">LabelProtocol</ref><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelAtlas" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelAtlas" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelBMFont" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLabelAtlas" /><para>Supported editors: <ulink url="http://glyphdesigner.71squared.com/">http://glyphdesigner.71squared.com/</ulink> (Commercial, Mac OS X) <ulink url="http://www.n4te.com/hiero/hiero.jnlp">http://www.n4te.com/hiero/hiero.jnlp</ulink> (Free, Java) <ulink url="http://slick.cokeandcode.com/demos/hiero.jnlp">http://slick.cokeandcode.com/demos/hiero.jnlp</ulink> (Free, Java) <ulink url="http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/">http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/</ulink> (Free, Windows only)</para><ulink url="http://glyphdesigner.71squared.com/">http://glyphdesigner.71squared.com/</ulink><ulink url="http://www.n4te.com/hiero/hiero.jnlp">http://www.n4te.com/hiero/hiero.jnlp</ulink><ulink url="http://slick.cokeandcode.com/demos/hiero.jnlp">http://slick.cokeandcode.com/demos/hiero.jnlp</ulink><ulink url="http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/">http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/</ulink><para> <para>v0.8 </para> </para><para>v0.8 </para><para>v0.8 </para>

public override Cocos2D.CCPoint AnchorPoint { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Sets the anchor point in percent.
Docs.remarks: <para>Sets the anchor point in percent.</para><para>anchorPoint is the point around which all transformations and positioning manipulations take place. It's like a pin in the node where it is "attached" to its parent. The anchorPoint is normalized, like a percentage. (0,0) means the bottom-left corner and (1,1) means the top-right corner. But you can use values higher than (1,1) and lower than (0,0) too. The default anchorPoint is (0.5,0.5), so it starts in the center of the node.</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>anchorPoint</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The anchor point of node. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>anchorPoint</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The anchor point of node. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>anchorPoint</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>anchorPoint</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>The anchor point of node. </para> </parameterdescription><para>The anchor point of node. </para>
